txt.en: 'Once we lived in kinship, and our tribes were as one.'
'I cannot pretend that my words alone will soothe the many wounds we have dealt one another over the years.'
'I will not plead for peace, nor will I forgive without condition.'
Many voices were heard as the parley continued
'But Soltakh has proven himself among the Trév Gállorg, and the change I have seen in him gives me hope that there is a new path to be taken.'
As the hours wore on, it seemed that ground was gained and lost in equal measure
'Let us walk it together. For Iarandír!'
To the surprise of many, old wounds began to give way to new understandings
And at last, the parley was ended
'Today we have gathered to Fail-á-Khro, not as Trév Gállorg or Trév Duvárdain, but as Men of Angmar. Nay, Men of Iarandír!'
'For too long, we have lived in the shadow of the Witch-king.'
'Our ways, our language, and our fates were all but stolen from us.'
'Enough has been said of the long years of animosity between our peoples, but we must not forget what came before.'
